title: Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Andirons", February 5, 1937
medium: Graphite and black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: 1 1/2/ANDERSON, DILLMANN/FEBR. 5TH 37; inscribed in graphite, upper left [from top to bottom]: LIBRARY/105/DINING ROOM/106/LIVING ROOM/104/STUDIO/213/MASTER BEDROOM/209; dimensions, materials, instructions in graphite
description: Plans and elevations for five sets of andirons for library, dining room, living room, studio, and master bedroom. Library andirons in shape of abstracted dachshunds with long body, cylindrical head, tubular legs, tail, flat ears and tongue. Dining room andirons with tall, flat front section with curved bottom; finial on top. Living room andirons with tall, flat front section and side panels, squared corners. Studio andirons with three vertical tubular strips, curved at bottom and along body; three finials at top. Master bedroom andirons are three tubular strips, curved at top.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Andirons", February 5, 1937.
February 5, 1937. Graphite and black ink on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-752.
